contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=September 2009}} {{Infobox UK place |country = England |static_image = [[File:esholtmay2005.JPG|240px]] |static_image_caption = Esholt, looking along Main Street |london_distance = |latitude= 53.8603 |longitude= -1.7202 |official_name= Esholt |population = 1,495 |population_ref = {{Citation needed |date=September 2009}} |metropolitan_borough= [[City of Bradford]] |metropolitan_county = [[West Yorkshire]] |region= Yorkshire and the Humber |constituency_westminster= [[Shipley (UK Parliament constituency)|Shipley]] |post_town= SHIPLEY |postcode_district = BD17 |postcode_area= BD |dial_code= 01274 |os_grid_reference= SE185405 }} '''Esholt''' is a [[village]] between [[Shipley, West Yorkshire|Shipley]] and [[Guiseley]], in the [[metropolitan district]] of the [[City of Bradford]], [[West Yorkshire]], England. == History == The name "Esholt" indicates that the village was first established in a heavily wooded area of [[European Ash|ash]] trees.{{Citation needed |date=September 2009}} [[File:EsholtOldHall.jpg|left|thumb|Esholt Old Hall, Church Lane]] In the 12th century, the Esholt estate was owned by [[Syningthwaite Priory]], and a [[nunnery]] was established at Lower Esholt. When the nunnery was dissolved in about 1540 the estate was granted to Henry Thompson by [[Edward IV]]. The original manor house, Esholt Old Hall at Upper Esholt is [[medieval]] in origin, probably 16th century, and possibly once had a [[moat]]. It is well-preserved and has [[Grade II* listed building]] status.<ref name="BLB:EH">{{Cite web |title=Esholt Hall with Terrace and Adjoining Conservatory |work=British Listed Buildings |accessdate=2011-09-12 |url=http://www.britishlistedbuildings.co.uk/en-336412-esholt-hall-with-terrace-and-adjoining-c}}</ref> In the 17th century the Thompson heiress married Walter Calverley (1629â€“1694) and in 1709 their son [[Sir Walter Calverley, 1st Baronet|Walter]] built a [[Queen Anne style architecture|Queen Anne style]] mansion house, Esholt Hall, on the site of the old nunnery. It is now used as a conference and staff learning centre and has Grade II* listed building status.<ref name="BLB:EH"/> In 1775 the Calverleys sold the estate to Robert Stansfield whose family remained in possession until 1906 when it was sold to Bradford City Council. The current owner of the estate, [[Yorkshire Water]], operates a [[sewage treatment]] plant on what was the location of the Airedale Aerodrome.<ref name="YFB">{{Cite book |last=Johnson |first=Graeme |title=Yorkshire Millennium Factbook |isbn=1-85568-168-4}}</ref> {{clear|left}} == Religion == [[File:St Paul's Church, Esholt - geograph.org.uk - 36391.jpg|left|thumb|St. Paul's Church]] Historically part of the parish of [[Guiseley]],<ref name="GEN:APoG">{{Cite web |url=http://www.genuki.org.uk/big/eng/YKS/WRY/Guiseley/index.html |title=The Ancient Parish of Guiseley |publisher=[[GENUKI]] |accessdate=2007-10-29}}</ref> the Church of St Paul is a successor to the private chapel of the old manor house. The church was built in 1839 by William Rookes Crompton-Stansfield for use as a private family chapel and not consecrated until 1853. Since 1983 it has been in the combined parish of Guiseley with Esholt.<ref> {{cite web|url = http://www.guiseleywithesholt.org.uk/index.php?PageID=stpauls| title =St Paul's Church| accessdate = 30 March 2013}} </ref> {{clear|left}} ==Popular culture== [[File:Esholt village - geograph.org.uk - 643131.jpg|left|thumb|The Woolpack, Main Street]] From 1976 to 1996 Esholt was used for outside location shots for the [[Yorkshire Television]] drama series ''[[Emmerdale|Emmerdale Farm later Emmerdale]]''.<ref name="IMDb">{{Cite web |url=http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0068069/locations |title=Filming locations for Emmerdale |work=IMDb |accessdate=2012-12-12}}</ref> The series relocated to a purpose built set based on the layout of Esholt on the [[Harewood House|Harewood estate]] in [[Leeds]].<ref name="IMDb"/> While the village was used as a filming location, the name of the village pub was changed from the Commercial Inn to [[The Woolpack]]. The Home Farm of the series is derived from the Home Farm that exists on the Esholt Estate, dating back to 1691. {{clear|left}} == References == {{reflist}} == External links == {{Commons category|Esholt}} {{clear}} == Navigation == {{NSEW <!-- N -->|[[Guiseley]] <!-- S -->|[[Thackley]] <!-- E -->|[[Yeadon, West Yorkshire|Yeadon]],<br />[[Rawdon, West Yorkshire|Rawdon]] <!-- W -->|[[Baildon]] <!-- NW -->| <!-- NE -->| <!-- SW -->| <!-- SE -->|[[Apperley Bridge]] }} {{Bradford}} [[Category:Villages in West Yorkshire]] [[Category:Grade II* listed buildings in West Yorkshire]] [[Category:Geography of Bradford]]
